001package com.technototes.library.util;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.Range;
004import java.util.function.DoubleConsumer;
005
006/**
007 * @author Alex Stedman
008 * Class for handling differentials
009 * Potential uses include:
010 *  - Differential (Tank) Drive
011 *  - Differential Swerve
012 *  - Differential Lifts and Slides
013 *  - Differential PTOs
014 *  - ETC.
015 */
016@SuppressWarnings({ "unused", "UnusedReturnValue" })
017public class Differential {
018
019    private final DoubleConsumer input1, input2;
020    private double average = 0, deviation = 0;
021    private double inputMin = -1, inputMax = 1;
022
023    /**
024     * Enum for the priority of the differential. This means that it will prioritize one of the
025     * outputs over the other if the value for one of the outputs exceeds the limits.
026     */
027    public enum DifferentialPriority {
028        NEUTRAL,
029        AVERAGE,
030        DIFFERENCE;
031
032        /**
033         * Calculates the value for the differential output generated by averaging
034         * @param avg the average output for the diff
035         * @param dif the deviation output for the diff
036         * @param min the minimum value for the inputs
037         * @param max the maximum value for the inputs
038         * @return the value to set the input to
039         */
040        public double calculateA(double avg, double dif, double min, double max) {
041            switch (this) {
042                case AVERAGE:
043                    if (avg - dif < min) dif = min - avg;
044                    if (avg - dif > max) dif = avg - max;
045                    break;
046                case DIFFERENCE:
047                    if (avg - dif < min) avg = dif - min;
048                    if (avg - dif > max) avg = max - dif;
049                    break;
050            }
051            return Range.clip(avg + dif, min, max);
052        }
053
054        /**
055         * Calculates the value for the differential output generated by subtracting
056         * @param avg the average output for the diff
057         * @param dif the deviation output for the diff
058         * @param min the minimum value for the inputs
059         * @param max the maximum value for the inputs
060         * @return the value to set the input to
061         */
062        public double calculateS(double avg, double dif, double min, double max) {
063            switch (this) {
064                case AVERAGE:
065                    if (avg + dif < min) dif = min - avg;
066                    if (avg + dif > max) dif = max - avg;
067                    break;
068                case DIFFERENCE:
069                    if (avg + dif < min) avg = min - dif;
070                    if (avg + dif > max) avg = max - dif;
071                    break;
072            }
073            return Range.clip(avg - dif, min, max);
074        }
075    }
076
077    private DifferentialPriority priority;
078
079    /**
080     * Create differential from two consumers
081     * @param i1 consumer 1 (additive input)
082     * @param i2 consumer 2 (subtractive input)
083     */
084    public Differential(DoubleConsumer i1, DoubleConsumer i2) {
085        this(i1, i2, DifferentialPriority.NEUTRAL);
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * Create differential from two consumers
090     * @param i1 consumer 1 (additive input)
091     * @param i2 consumer 2 (sutractiveb input)
092     * @param p the differential {@link DifferentialPriority} to set the diff to
093     */
094    public Differential(DoubleConsumer i1, DoubleConsumer i2, DifferentialPriority p) {
095        input1 = i1;
096        input2 = i2;
097        priority = p;
098    }
099
100    /**
101     * Set the average of the differential.
102     * This corresponds to whatever setting the two inputs
103     * to the same direction will do
104     * @param value the value to set
105     * @return this
106     */
107    public Differential setAverageOutput(double value) {
108        average = value;
109        return updateOutputs();
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Set the deviation of the differential.
114     * This corresponds to whatever setting the two nputs
115     * to the opposite direction will do
116     * @param value the value to set
117     * @return this
118     */
119    public Differential setDeviationOutput(double value) {
120        deviation = value;
121        return updateOutputs();
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * Set both outputs for the differential
126     * @param aValue the average output
127     * @param dValue the deviation output
128     * @return this
129     */
130    public Differential setOutputs(double aValue, double dValue) {
131        average = aValue;
132        deviation = dValue;
133        return updateOutputs();
134    }
135
136    private Differential updateOutputs() {
137        input1.accept(priority.calculateA(average, deviation, inputMin, inputMax));
138        input2.accept(priority.calculateS(average, deviation, inputMin, inputMax));
139        return this;
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Gets the current average of the two differential inputs,
144     * equating to one of the outputs
145     * @return the current average
146     */
147    public double getAverage() {
148        return average;
149    }
150
151    /**
152     * Gets the current deviation between the two differential inputs and the average,
153     * equating to one of the outputs
154     * @return the current average
155     */
156    public double getDeviation() {
157        return deviation;
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Gets the priority for the difference output.
162     * @return The current {@link DifferentialPriority}
163     */
164    public DifferentialPriority getDifferentialPriority() {
165        return priority;
166    }
167
168    /**
169     * Sets the priority for the differential.
170     * @param priority the new {@link DifferentialPriority}
171     * @return this
172     */
173    public Differential setPriority(DifferentialPriority priority) {
174        this.priority = priority;
175        return updateOutputs();
176    }
177
178    /**
179     * Set the limits for the differential
180     * @param min the new minimum for the input
181     * @param max the new maximum for the input
182     * @return this
183     */
184    public Differential setLimits(double min, double max) {
185        inputMin = min;
186        inputMax = max;
187        return updateOutputs();
188    }
189}
